name: "Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers" - Miniseries Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Ranger was able to return to his or her natural age before all of the others?
questions.explanation:
Billy.

	Billy used the six power coins to build a machine that would counteract the effects of the Orb  of Doom. After using it on himself it was stolen and the coins destroyed before he could use it on the other Rangers. This made Billy appear as a teenager for most of the miniseries, while the other Rangers remained children.  This was revealed in the third episode of the series.

questions.text: What device did the Rangers have to find in order to restore the planet?
questions.explanation:
Zeo Crystal.

	Earlier in the third season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers" the Rangers had found the crystal, broken it into five pieces and scattered it through time and space in order to hide it from evil. In order to restore the Earth they had to find and reassemble the crystal. The quest for the Zeo Crystal began in the sixth episode of the series.

questions.text: Who was the leader of the alien Rangers?
questions.explanation:
Delphine.

	Delphine was the first female team leader in the "Power Rangers" franchise. She was the white alien Ranger. She was played by Rajia Baroudi. She introduced herself as the leader in several episodes.

questions.text: In the third episode of the series, which villain tried to kidnap the students on the school bus?
questions.explanation:
Rito Revolto.

	Rito and Goldar went to do the kidnapping, Goldar waited outside the bus and Rito got on it. While on the bus Rito was attacked by the students who tossed water balloons, food and anything else they had at him.

questions.text: Billy tried to make a machine to duplicate the waters of Aquatar. What happened instead?
questions.correct: The device turned the water into a toxin.
options: Master Vile stole the device and destroyed it.
The device backfired and evaporated the lake.
Billy couldn't get it to work right and the Alien Rangers left the Earth.
questions.explanation:
The device turned the water into a toxin.

	In the fourth episode of the series, Billy built the machine. The machine worked properly at first, but Lord Zedd dumped "space waste" in the water. While Billy's machine took the Earth properties out of the water, the new toxins were too much and the machine actually amplified the toxins in the water.

questions.text: The Alien Rangers were forced to return to their home planet in the fourth episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	With Billy's device destroyed, the five Alien Rangers had to return to Aquatar or risk dying. Delphine promised they would be available to return if the situation was in dire needs in the future.

questions.text: In the fifth episode, Zedd and Rita used a human to create a monster. Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Bulk.

	Bulk was deemed the "nastiest" child in the Rangers class and was turned into a monster. The episode was titled "Attack of the 60-foot Bulk". The monster he was turned into was called Brat Boy.

questions.text: Which of the Earth Rangers were not sent on a quest to help find new powers?
questions.explanation:
Billy Cranston.

	Billy had already been returned to his normal age and size. However, him not going on a quest was also a precursor to him not becoming a Ranger when the Zeo Crystal restored their powers. Billy stayed on the team, but did not earn Zeo powers, instead he became a supporter in the command center with Alpha and Zordon.

questions.text: What country did Adam get sent to in order to fulfil his quest for new powers?
questions.explanation:
Korea.

	Each of the Rangers was sent on a quest that involved their own heritage. Adam to Korea, Kat to Australia, Rocky to Italy, Aisha to Africa and Tommy with the native Americans.

questions.text: In the eighth episode of the miniseries, Rita and Zedd summoned an evil villain from Aquatar to fight the Alien Rangers. What was the monster's name?
questions.explanation:
Hydro Hog.

	Hydro Hog was the biggest villain the Aquitian Rangers had on their home planet. His goal was to steal the entire water supply from the planet.
